channel.title: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates
channel.description:
We are excited to share the official release dates for **Version 16** of ERPNext, Frappe HRMS, and the Frappe Framework.
ğŸ§ª **Beta Release: 15th November 2025**
ğŸš€ **Final Release: ~~6th December 2025~~** **12th January 2026 (read [update here](https://discuss.coworker365.com/t/erpnext-hrms-frappe-framework-v16-release-dates/156349/53?u=ankush))**
### âœ¨ Feature Highlights
**ERPNext**
* Customizable templates for financial statements
* Inward subcontracting
* MRP enhancements
* Consolidated trial balance
* Improved default print formats
* Performance optimisation for accounting reports
* Serial and batch traceability report
* Landed cost for stock entries & subcontracting receipts
* Stock reservation for subcontracting & production
* Track semi-finished goods via Job Cards
* POS improvements
* Enhanced budgeting
* Asset module refactoring
* Refactored TDS
* Stock accounting based on Item / Item Group
* Separate COGS and Service expense accounting
**HRMS**
* Overtime management
* Arrears & loss-of-pay correction
* Multi-currency expense claims
* Employee benefits
* Leave adjustments
* Earned leave schedule
* Holiday list enhancements
**Frappe Framework**
* Completely redesigned Workspace (desktop, module cells, navigation)
* \~2Ã— faster performance
* Enhanced List View: scrollable, resizable columns, unlimited fields, etc
* Scrollable child tables with sticky columns
* Custom print formats for reports
* Role-based field masking
* Chrome-based PDF converter
We invite all community members to explore the beta, try the new features, and share your feedback. If you find any bugs, please create an issue in the respective GitHub repository.
Your feedback helps us ship the most stable and refined release possible ğŸ’ª
Letâ€™s make **v16** the most stable and delightful release yet! ğŸš€

item.title: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates
item.dc:creator: JeansReal
item.description:
Yes, parts of it, Please read: Migrating to version 16 Â· frappe/frappe Wiki Â· GitHub

Separating modules from frappe into new apps

Continuing last yearâ€™s trend. some more modules have been moved out as separate apps:

  • Energy Points (removed in #32040)

  • Newsletter (removed in #32971)

  • Backup Integrations (removed in #32351)

  • Blog (removed in #32737)

You may need to install those apps accordingly

Read full topic

item.title: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates
item.dc:creator: TRACKOMATIC_INDIA
item.description:
Finally managed to make the system up. after finishing the setup and looging in the system, everthing works fine apart from a single problem..
I am not able to go to the default website pageâ€¦
Whenever I select the website from top left corner, i always land on the module selection screenâ€¦
If I logout from the system, I always land on Login Pageâ€¦

the standard website pages home, products, blogâ€¦ etc are not working anymore in v16. however, about is still workingâ€¦

If we select any of the standard page, it throws an error and says page not found:

Has the website module been completely removed from the v16??

Read full topic

item.title: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates
item.dc:creator: ankush
item.description:
RC for ERPNext and HR is also live:

  • Release v16.0.0-rc.1 Â· frappe/erpnext Â· GitHub
  • Release v16.0.0-rc.1 Â· frappe/hrms Â· GitHub

We are now exclusively focusing on polishing and bug fixes before we do a final release. Feel free to spin up a test site and/or a UAT site with your data to test it out.

If youâ€™re reporting an issue on GitHub, please use [v16] in the title somewhere so we can prioritise looking at those issues before release.

Read full topic

item.title: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates
item.dc:creator: compgeniuses
item.description:
michelle:

We will plan something like this for maybe v17 though.

I THink Not Algning records in V16, would bee a great wasted Opportunity.

My thought for Implementaiton is, DO not Remove the Current ERPNEXT CRM, retain Both, However, Make it so, Using either of the Apps, either erpnext crm, or Frappe CRM, does not affect Anything at all, and that users, can Add Recrods, in either Side, and Use whatever Interface they choose.

This will be aligned, FOr additional features in Frappe crm, not in erpnext crm, the user will simply use the frappe crm, and vice versa.

Erpnext CRM, uses the standard concepts of LPO(Leads, Prospects, Opportunities)
the new Frappe CRM, uses, Deals Concepts. That should be a starting Point.

Both use and share, comapnies, as well as contats, thats a plus, however, some workflows, available in frappe crm, are not in erpnext crm, and vise versa, while the same recrods are used, you cant find them in eahc f the Suite,s merge these, its an easy fix, Maybe 1 Day worth of work.

The Status of Leads, in erpenxt crm, is very differently names, compared to status, in frappe crm, THis causes it to be that, Leads in frappe crm, cant be seen in erpnext crm, and similer leads in erpnext crm cant be seen in frappe crm. thats a good starting point, for merging these two in V16.

Among others, then in future as you say v17, work on remoing the one, and retaining only one.

Read full topic

item.source: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates

item.title: ERPNext, HRMS & Frappe Framework v16 Release Dates
item.dc:creator: ankush
item.description:
Update on the release date. We have decided to delay the stable release considering the following factors:

  • Feedback on beta release + missing polish of new UI changes, especially the new navigation and desktop view.
  • New addition in scope - We are making UI similar to Espresso-based new apps.
  • Ongoing security audit of v16 code changes
  • Pending docs updates
  • Code cleanups, deprecation and migrations

New plan:

  • Weâ€™ll continue releasing beta versions as and when major milestones are achieved. Expect 3-4 more beta releases. These can be breaking in nature, so read the accompanying release notes and migration guide before updating.
  • Weâ€™ll do a â€œrelease candidateâ€ mid-December when weâ€™ve frozen all major changes. Only fixes will be merged after this freeze.
  • Final release will be on 12th January 2026. (~3 weeks after RC release, after intense internal, partner and community-driven testing and fixes)

I know it sucks to wait and delay the release like this, but itâ€™s better to do it right the first time. Letâ€™s (actually) make this the most stable major release so far.

Read full topic
